THE Subscriber offers for private sale, valua.
BILE Farm, lying on the turnpike, leading to Elk,
about two miles below Chistiana-B Bridge. 1t con-
tans ~ acres, so of which are under thriving tim
Der, and the remainder under tillage, with good
proportion well set with clover: there is also on the
premises good bearing orchard--the fences are in
good order. The buildings are good dwelling
house. stable and granary. A further description
will be given, and the land shewn to any one apply
ing, by the subscriber living on the Plantation.


WILLIAM Is. M'lNTIRE.


15--tlDec

THAT an ELECTION will be held at the same
time and at the places and IN the same manner,
that Senators, and Representative for the said coun
ty chosen. for the purpose of electing as Com
missioners of the Levy Court and Court of Appeal
in the said County. one good and substantial Free
holder residing in Pcncader Hundred, one good and
substantial Frceholder residing in Red Lion Hun

in St. Georges Hundrde, and one good and subsan-
tial Freeholder residing in White Clay Greek Hun
dred, to supply the vacancies occasioned by The ex-
piraton of the times, for which Jacob Faris, Philip
Reybold John Janvicr and John Herdnan, were

Court Of Appeal

are, that the purchaser pay the first day of Ja-
nuary 1923, 500, and the balance ofthe purchase
money in six sem-annua payments Any person
wishing to purchase will please view the property,
which will be shown to them by my miller, in my
absence from home. Possession may be had imme-
diately, or whenever the property is sold. If it
should not be sold by the first Monday in October,
it win then be offered at Public sale, at 10 o'clock
A. NJ. at Mr. Moneys tavern in Chestertown. A
good and sufficient deed will be given to the pur-
chaser when the property shall be paid for Any
further information relative to said property can be
had by applying to the subscriber on the premises
or through the Post Office Chestertown.


JAMES HANSON.

THE SUBSCRIBER wishes to sell the Grst
and Saw Mills situated at the head of Morsan's
Creek, Kent County, Md. about five miles IRON
Chestertown. This very valuable property will b.
sold to good purchaser, on such terms as will Sc
cure on the amount of the purchase, an interest, ii
the property be rented from ten to twelve per cent
per annum.


During the last and the present year the Grist
Mill has been well repaired on the improved plan
ofcast iron cog wheels, working into avery large spur
wheel: and every part of the running gears, water
wheel and great frame, husk, it is Called has
been made entirely new, within few months past,
and also, pier head ore-bay, boiling cloth and
gears are new and of the best quay-the mill is
making some of the best meal and flour in Kent
County The stream which said mills are built
is far superior to any in Kent County, so much so
that grain at this very dry sent to her from
Is to 90 miles. and at all seasons excellent sup.
ply of country custom is offered and the water
power ie sufficient to do merchant work and manu-.
featuring of different kinds on very extensive
scale. The Saw Mill is in very good order ant
can be very proiabIy employed until a drouyh
prevails. The Dam and Flood Gates are in goot
order

sooTT's LIFE OF BoNAP ARTE.


Just received and for sale by r. PORTER &.
full articles.article:
Commencing with the Peace of Versallesi in 49,


and giving concise history, of the most important
events in Europe, as well detailed account of
the sanguinary battles in which he engaged in or
connected with, down to the time of his death, in
l82l-in three closely printed vo vols. A more
valuable record, has perhaps seldom been offered TO
the Public and the facts rendered still more In
teresting by the popular talent Of the noble writer.

June 90, 1927
